bibl.title: Letter from Wilbur A. Lazier to Philip Showalter Hench, February 28, 1952

div1.p: Lazier thanks Hench for his note discussing the Lazear family, and will use the information in future research.

div1.head: Letter from Wilbur A. Lazier to Philip Showalter Hench, February 28, 1952
div1.opener:
CHAS. PFIZER& CO., INC.
ESTABLISHED 1849
Manufacturing Chemists
11 BARTLETT STREET
BROOKLYN 6, N.Y.
February 28th, 1952.
PLANTS & LABORATORIES
BROOKLYN, N.Y.
GROTON, CONN.
TERRE HAUTE, IND.
SALES OFFICES
BROOKLYN
NEW YORK
CHICAGO
SAN FRANCISCO
WILBUR A. LAZIER
DIRECTOR OF
CHEMICAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your note of February
22nd which continues our Havana discussion of
the Lazear tribe.

I have been so engrossed in running
down the group which spell their name as I do
that I have really not got back into the Lazears.
However, I hope to do this sometime and will
keep your note for future reference.

It was good to meet you in Havana and
to hear your discussion of the cortisone problem.
div1.closer: Cordially yours, Wilbur A. Lazier WAL:jmb
